Package com.backend

Class Date

java.lang.Object
com.backend.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Comparable<Date>, Comparator<Date>
public class Date
extends Object
implements Comparator<Date>, Comparable<Date>, Cloneable
Creates a date class to store the date. This would allow easy storage and manipulation of the date

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Date()
    Constructs a Date of the First Day of the Common Era, to use as a Minimum Date
    Date​(boolean noDate)
    A Date which starts off as "Fake" because it hasn't been given any value
    Date​(int year, int month, int day)
    Constructs a date given all its information

  • Method Details

    • optionToDate

      public static Date optionToDate​(String s)
      Takes the options included in Charts.java and returns their related Date values

      This is used for Dates which are based on the String Values, such as Week, Month, and Year. This typicaly is useful in reports when the user is choosing a date range

      Parameters:
      s - The Option Selected
      Returns:
      A Date with the constraints put on by the Option

    • getMonth

      public static int getMonth​(String month)
      Converts a String of the month to its respective Integer values

      This method allows the use of String-based months alongside their Integer-based counterparts, allowing easy conversion in one direction.

      Parameters:
      month - The month as a string
      Returns:
      The integer value of the month

    • getMonth

      public static String getMonth​(int month)
      Converts an Integer of the month to its respective String-based version

      This method allows the use of String-based months alongside their Integer-based counterparts, allowing easy conversion in one direction.

      Parameters:
      month - The month as an Integer
      Returns:
      The String value of the month

    • setDate

      public void setDate​(String date)
      Takes a Date in the String format and converts it into a Date object.

      For this method to work, the date has to be in the format of yyyy-mm-dd

      Parameters:
      date - the Date as a String

    • getLocalDate

    • setDate

      public void setDate​(LocalDate date)

      Parameters:
      date - The LocalDate being converted.
